function.name: addsubnode
function.description: Add the provided HTML/XML string newnode as a child to node, optionally at position beforenode. Returns the newly created node.

example.description: Given an XML-file note.xml, which contains:

examples.example: <note> <to>Tove</to> <from>Jani</from> <heading>Reminder</heading> <body>Don't forget me this weekend!</body> <comment>Comments are welcome.</comment> </note>
<note> <to>Tove</to> <from>Jani</from> <heading>Reminder</heading> <comment>Comments are welcome.</comment> <body>Don't forget me this weekend!</body> </note>

example.description: Note: Never mind the indentation of <body>, this is a known issue. <comment> and <body> are on the same level.
